result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Singer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04/01/2015 and each month thereafter or penalty of 11 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
06/16/15 COURT GRANTS TO VACATE DNA SURCHARGE. MONIES PAID APPLIED TO COURT COSTS.
Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 43 days were granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R Singer

defendant.name: Singer, Steven R
defendant.address: W280 S3771 Townline Road Lower, Waukesha, WI 53189

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 06/03/15, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting waiver of DNA surcharge.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven R Singer in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

70 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 43 days)

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 4/1/15, alternate 11 days jail if not paid)
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven R Singer in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests a plea an sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or her residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Steven R Singer in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defendant allowed phone call.  Hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
